quotes.quote: People who don't take risks generally make about two big mistakes a year. People who do take risks generally make about two big mistakes a year.
Allow yourself to be inspired. Allow yourself to succeed. Dare to excel.
You may not know where you're going, but so long as you spread your wings the winds will carry you.
To dare is to lose one's footing momentarily. Not to dare is to lose oneself.
Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
He that cannot reason is a fool. He that will not is a bigot. He that dare not is a slave.
It often requires more courage to dare to do right than to fear to do wrong.
Don't dare to be different, dare to be yourself - if that doesn't make you different then something is wrong.
Who dares nothing, need hope for nothing.
Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
A person needs a little madness, or else they never dare cut the rope and be free.
Dare to err and to dream. Deep meaning often lies in childish plays.
Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
Dare to be a fool in the face of impossibilities.
It is impossible to win the race unless you venture to run, impossible to win the victory unless you dare to battle.
This is no time for ease and comfort. It is time to dare and endure.
He who knows how to suffer everything can dare everything.
Dare to be true. Nothing can need a lie: a fault which needs it most, grows two thereby.
Everything you dare in life reveals the giant in you.
In order to conquer, what we need is to dare, still to dare, and always to dare.
What a man dares to do, he should dare to confess- unless he is a coward.
One must work and dare if one really wants to live.
A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
Dare to wear the foolish clown face.
We must dare, and dare again, and go on daring.
It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
The only dare you ever want to take is the dare to be all that you can be.
When somebody challenges you, fight back. Be brutal, be tough.
We become strong by embracing vulnerability, we dare more greatly when we acknowledge our fear.
You must have long-range goals to keep you from being frustrated by short-range failures.
We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be.
Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
Trust your own instinct. Your mistakes might as well be your own, instead of someone else's.
To dare to dream in the midst of adversity, in the midst of failure, in the midst of complacency, is to have hope.
We no longer dare to believe in beauty and we make of it a mere appearance in order the more easily to dispose of it.
Don't dare a person who has nothing else left to lose.
Dare to be the best you can at all times, dare to be!
There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbours will say.
Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
Don't you dare underestimate the power of your own instinct.
Dare to be honest and fear no labor.
